job.title: Salesforce Media Cloud Technical Architect (34391)
job.description:
Salesforce Media Cloud Technical Architect (Ad Sales & Campaigns)
Remote U.S. | 12-Month Contract | Start: January 2026
Myticas Consulting is seeking an experienced Salesforce Media Cloud Technical Architect for a long-term consulting engagement. This role is ideal for professionals who have direct, hands-on implementation experience with Salesforce Media Cloud and are eager to take ownership of complex, enterprise-level architecture initiatives.
What You’ll Do
  • Lead the design and implementation of Salesforce Media Cloud solutions, including Ad Sales Management, Campaign Hierarchies, Contracts, and Placements.
  • Define data models, system architecture, and integrations with ad servers, billing systems, and rights management platforms.
  • Drive cross-cloud integrations across Media Cloud, Service Cloud, and Marketing Cloud.
  • Establish technical best practices and provide mentorship to development teams.
  • Ensure compliance, scalability, and performance across all stages of the project lifecycle.
What We’re Looking For
  • 7+ years of Salesforce ecosystem experience.
  • 2+ years of proven, hands-on Salesforce Media Cloud implementation experience (not just exposure) — ideally across Ad Sales, Campaign Hierarchies, Media Planning, and Contract Lifecycle Management.
  • Strong technical background in Apex, Lightning, SOQL, and Salesforce integrations (REST/SOAP).
  • Experience with Revenue Scheduling, Rate Cards, and Dynamic Pricing.
  • Deep understanding of Salesforce data architecture, security, and performance optimization.
Preferred Experience
  • Familiarity with Salesforce Industries (Media & Entertainment Cloud), formerly known as Vlocity Media Cloud.
  • Exposure to advanced Media Cloud features (Inventory, Forecasting, Analytics).
  • Experience with AdTech/MarTech integrations (FreeWheel, Google Ad Manager, Operative).
  • Proficiency with Salesforce DevOps tools (Gearset, Copado, Jenkins).
  • Agile/Scrum delivery experience.
  • Salesforce Media Cloud Consultant or Technical Architect certification preferred.
Why This Role Stands Out
  • Join a specialized consulting team working with one of the earliest enterprise adopters of Salesforce Media Cloud.
  • Influence cross-cloud architecture and integration strategy in a high-visibility role.
  • Work alongside top Salesforce industry experts solving real-world Ad Sales and Campaign challenges.
This is a high-impact consulting role designed for Salesforce professionals who have successfully delivered hands-on Media Cloud implementations and are ready to lead at scale.
If that sounds like you, we’d love to connect.

job.title: Salesforce Media Cloud Solution Architect (34390)
job.description:
Salesforce Media Cloud Solutions Architect – Contract Opportunity
Remote U.S. | 12-Month Engagement | Start: January 2026
Myticas Consulting is seeking an experienced Salesforce Media Cloud Solutions Architect for a long-term consulting engagement. This is a hands-on leadership role for someone who thrives at the intersection of technology and business strategy, helping enterprise clients maximize their investment in Salesforce Media Cloud.
What You’ll Do

  • Translate business requirements into scalable Salesforce Media Cloud solutions (Ad Sales Management, Campaigns, Contracts, Placements).
  • Define and oversee solution architecture while ensuring alignment with Salesforce best practices.
  • Lead workshops, discovery sessions, and solution demos to validate and refine designs.
  • Drive cross-cloud strategy, integrating Media Cloud with Sales Cloud, Service Cloud, and Marketing Cloud.
  • Collaborate with stakeholders, product owners, and technical teams to ensure adoption and measurable business value.
  • Partner with Technical Architects to ensure technical feasibility and smooth delivery.
  • Support client adoption with documentation, training, and knowledge transfer.
What We’re Looking For
  • 7+ years of Salesforce ecosystem experience, including at least 2+ years with Media Cloud.
  • Proven success designing solutions across Ad Sales, Campaign Hierarchies, Media Plans, and Contract Lifecycle Management.
  • Expertise in Media Cloud data model, workflows, and core business processes.
  • Strong communication skills and ability to work with both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
  • Track record of leading solution design from requirements through delivery.
Preferred Experience
  • Leading Media Cloud discovery and solution workshops.
  • Familiarity with advanced Media Cloud features (inventory, forecasting, analytics).
  • Exposure to ad-tech/mar-tech integrations (FreeWheel, Google Ad Manager, Operative).
  • Agile/Scrum delivery experience.
  • Salesforce certifications such as Application Architect, Data Architect, or Industry Cloud Consultant.


This is a unique opportunity to shape enterprise-scale Media Cloud solutions while working with a dynamic team of Salesforce experts. If you’re a Salesforce Solutions Architect looking for your next consulting project, we want to hear from you!

job.title: Accounting Manager (34402)
job.description:
Myticas's direct client, based in Philadelphia, PA, is currently seeking a Accounting Manager for a hybrid contract to hire position.

 

Additional Information:  W2 only!

  • Hybrid position - 2 to 3 days per week onsite, open to candidates local to Philadelphia, PA
  • This is a Temp-to-Hire Position 

Job Description:

The Accounting Manager plays a critical role in overseeing the accounting and financial reporting functions, ensuring accuracy, timeliness, and compliance with internal controls. This position requires a detail-oriented, analytical thinker with strong leadership capabilities and the ability to navigate complex accounting scenarios proactively.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:
• Lead and support the month-end close and reporting process in alignment with the reporting calendar.
• Supervise and mentor accounting staff, providing guidance, performance feedback, and support to improve processes — including the quality of account reconciliations.
• Review, analyze, and approve general ledger transactions to ensure completeness and accuracy.
• Oversee the preparation and review of balance sheet account reconciliations on a monthly, quarterly, and semi-annual basis.
• Proactively identify and resolve accounting issues, escalating, when necessary, with recommended solutions.
• Support internal and external audits by providing requested documentation and addressing inquiries professionally.
• Maintain and update desktop procedures and checklists to reflect changes in processes and tools.
• Maintain and monitor month-end close, reporting, and operational checklists to ensure timely and complete task execution before sign-off.
• Prepare and review supporting schedules and financial analyses as needed.
• Collaborate effectively with internal teams and third-party service providers to ensure smooth operations.
• Conduct independent analysis to identify opportunities for process improvement and implement recommendations.
• Support the timely research and resolution of reconciling items to ensure accuracy and compliance with deadlines.
• Demonstrate adaptability to changing business requirements and provide leadership and support to staff during transitions.
• Take initiative in identifying issues and opportunities, follow through on projects, and proactively recommend solutions to improve processes and resolve challenges.

Required Qualifications/Experience/Skills: 
• 7–9 years of accounting/audit experience, including 2–3 years in a managerial role.
• Ideal candidates must have current or recent (within the past 1–2 years) experience managing teams responsible for core general ledger functions. This includes hands-on oversight of month-end close, journal entry preparation and review, balance sheet and bank reconciliations, intercompany transactions, and audit support.
• Bachelor’s degree in Accounting (BBA or BS); Master’s degree preferred.
• CPA certification or progress toward certification strongly preferred.

A strong and recent focus on GL is required to be considered for this role:
• Experience with international accounting is a plus.
• Proficiency in major ERP systems (SAP, Great Plains, NetSuite) and Blackline.
• Advanced skills in Microsoft Office Suite (Excel, Word, PowerPoint, Access).
• Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with a detail-oriented approach.
• Proven ability to manage teams and work independently in a fast-paced environment.
• Comfortable working with accelerated month-end close timelines (3–5 days).
• Excellent communication and interpersonal skills to foster cross-functional collaboration.
• Project management experience is highly desirable.
• Flexibility to work hybrid hours and coordinate effectively during close/reporting cycles.

job.title: SAP Technical Analyst (PPDS, EWM, TM) (34547)
job.description:
Clover Consulting has a direct client in Grand Rapids, MI in need of an SAP Technical Analyst (PPDS, EWM, TM) for a 12++ month contract with the potential for hire.  This is an On-Site role in Grand Rapids, MI.  The skills required are below:

12 Months
$80/hr BR

SAP Technical Analyst - onsite in Grand Rapids, MI full time 

Technical Analyst
We are looking for a technical analyst with primarily SAP S/4 experience to contribute to the objectives of our global team and its ongoing projects. In this role, you will apply Agile methodologies to facilitate the efficient delivery of robust SAP S/4 technical solutions that advance cross-functional business strategies and initiatives.
 
The team you will be part of    
 
We are a global team managing the migration from SAP ECC to S/4 to support manufacturing, distribution, and logistics. Our versatile members ensure smooth transition and ongoing ECC technical support, working collaboratively to achieve team objectives and align with company goals.
 
Primary Responsibilities
 
As a technical analyst, your responsibilities will include:
·         Interpreting functional specifications and translating them into implementable and supportable technical solutions
·         Developing technical specifications utilizing standardized templates
·         Creating and maintaining comprehensive technical documentation
·         Conducting research on S/4 platform best practices to address business process requirements
·         Collaborating with technical developers to ensure deliverables meet business requirements and expectations
·         Unit testing developed solutions
·         Troubleshooting business and technical processes on platforms such as SAP ECC, S/4, and .Net
·         Applying minor ABAP code enhancements and SAP configuration
·         Applying Agile methodologies and principles throughout the entire development lifecycle
·         Maintaining up-to-date knowledge of emerging technologies and proactively sharing innovative ideas for process improvement
·         Providing support for end-user requests or issues through the incident reporting tool, ServiceNow
 
Knowledge and Skills
·         Experience in SAP S/4
·         Experience in SAP S/4 modules PPDS, EWM, and/or TM
·         Experience in maintaining SAP system configuration (SPRO)
·         Experience in SAP ECC a plus
·         Experience with Agile methodologies and concepts
·         Experience in debugging transactions, ABAP programs, and function modules
·         Experience in writing ABAP code a plus
·         Experience with Microsoft Office Suite, including Word, Excel, Visio, and PowerPoint
·         Knowledgeable in all aspects of ABAP development, including reports, enhancements, interfaces, function modules, workflows, and classes
·         Knowledgeable in Fiori, SAPUI5, CDS views, OData technologies, APIs, Cloud Platform, HANA DB, and implementing or extending standard SAP Fiori applications
·         Knowledgeable in BADIs, enhancement points, BAPIs, IDOCs, and Web Services
·         Knowledgeable in Discreet Manufacturing a plus
·         Knowledgeable in Make to Order (MTO) a plus
·         Knowledgeable in manufacturing BOMs and Routings a plus
·         Knowledgeable with Azure DevOps (ADO) a plus
 
Who you are
 
·         Build strong relationships and communicate clearly and effectively with diverse team members
·         Demonstrate a strong work ethic, share knowledge, achieve goals, and meet deadlines
·         Apply solid problem-solving and analytical abilities
·         Adaptable, as team members must work in modules/areas of S/4 and ECC that they are not familiar with
·         Facilitate data-driven discussions and decisions
·         Support projects that enhance business capabilities
·         Tackle complex system challenges with intuitive thinking
·         Stay updated on system methods, emerging technologies, and best practices
·         Focus on serving the team, customers, IT, and Steelcase
·         Collaborate with cross-functional, global teams
·         Lead and teach others empathetically

job.title: RAN Support Engineer (34586)
job.description:
Myticas is looking for a RAN Support Engineer. The Candidate will work as onsite Resident Engineer with our clients customer and MUST have recent experience and able to meet the following requirements:
  • Perform first level of troubleshooting/response for anomalies found in the above elements.
  • Raise tickets with care team for issues that he couldn’t solve.
  • Support activities/migrations/upgrades/ Implement change requests on behalf of customer (those are normally carried out by care team).
  • Prepare/review MOPs of activities. (if this is covered in the sow for RE)

  • Maintain accurate records of network configurations, changes, and upgrades
  • Lead trained contractors and BSS engineers during installation and integration of telecommunication equipment.
  • Conducted trials & features testing, launched new products. (if this is covered in the sow for RE)

REQUIREMENTS:
  • O&M experience in Airscale, FlexiZone (Indoor & outdoor) BTS site solutions

  • Experience in troubleshooting and tracing tools (Emil tool kit, DCAP, UTF, 5G tool kit ..etc)
  • Experience in OSS various applications (CM operation manager, CM Editor, Work Flow tool, Software manager, Monitor Application..etc)

job.title: Banking Industry Expert (Core Banking / Hogan SME) (34566)
job.description:
Overview

Our client is seeking a Banking Industry Expert to support the evolution and market positioning of their enterprise SaaS platform. Reporting directly to the Senior Vice President, Markets, you will draw on deep banking expertise.  Specifically in product management, pricing, billing, and digital enablement, to advise internal teams and help shape market and client strategies.
This is a strategic, high-visibility role for a seasoned banking professional who thrives in cross-functional environments.

Key Responsibilities
 
  • Leverage your banking expertise to shape solution approaches tailored to client needs.
  • Collaborate closely with Product Management to align the product roadmap with evolving market demands.
  • Work with delivery teams to assess client requirements and guide solution design and implementation.
  • Contribute to and enhance product marketing collateral, frameworks, and go-to-market material.
  • Represent the organization at industry events, conferences, and client-facing forums.

Must-Have Qualifications
 
  • 10+ years of experience in banking, ideally within corporate or retail environments.
  • Deep knowledge of product management, pricing, billing, and digital banking strategies.
  • Strong experience developing and presenting client-facing solution proposals.
  • Ability to analyze both functional and non-functional requirements and contribute to solution design.
  • Technical proficiency across modern enterprise platforms and solution architecture concepts.
  • Proven ability to produce high-quality business specifications and high-level solution designs.
  • Thrives in fast-moving, evolving team environments.
  • Willingness and ability to travel as needed.

Hogan Core Banking is a Requirement for this position:
  • Experience with Hogan or other legacy core banking systems.
  • Hands-on exposure to Hogan Core, Hogan Deposits, or large-scale legacy core banking transformations.
  • Understanding of how modern SaaS platforms integrate with Hogan-based deposit, pricing, or billing systems—an asset that will distinguish top candidates.

job.title: Quality Assurance Lead (34610)
job.description:
Clover Consulting has a direct client in Grand Rapids, MI in need of a Software QA with Leadership experience for and ON-SITE role.  This is for a 6-12 months contract with the potential for hire.  Client cannot sponsor.  

Given the scale and complexity of the program, it is critical for candidates to demonstrate leadership, cross team coordination, communication, and the ability to command a room in order to be successful in this role. Those moving forward should be able to showcase these skills with concrete examples from their own experience.

What you will be doing:  
  • Take ownership to ensure the test deliverables are met to standards, quality practices and end-user requirements for IT projects and programs
  • Coordinate within and across teams to create test strategy, test plans, timelines and alignment on test execution
  • Coordinate within and across teams to build test scenarios, test cases, test data and other quality-related deliverables
  • ?Develop comprehensive test strategies with input from developers, analysts, enabling teams and process experts
  • Facilitate the development of test plans, test scenarios and test cases for Product Teams
  • Ensure test data and other needed information is prepared and available for test execution
  • Align with Program test deliverables and take ownership in preparing and coordinating testing for your assigned teams
  • Ensure test deliverables are met on time to meet program requirements
  • Take responsibility to facilitate and coordinate test execution within and across project teams
  • Take ownership to coordinate cross team test execution and make sure test progress is made on day to day basis
  • Coordinate and facilitate the bug life cycle to remove blockers promptly during test coordination
  • Ensure bugs are logged and assigned to the respective owner to fix
  • Make sure bugs get retested to ensure the fix is applied and the feature works as expected
  • Create test reports and dashboard to provide quality metrics and analysis on testing
  • Collaborate closely with other team members to continuously improve and adjust standards and practices.
  • Partner with Automation Specialists to deliver automated testing strategies by providing manual test scripts, test data and other relevant information for automation
 
Key Skillset to have:
 
  • Project Management experience
  • Leadership
  • Strong QA expertise
  • Problem solving
  • Cross team coordination
  • Strong communication
  • Self - driven and self-motivated
  • Committed to deliver results on time
·Ability to quickly jump into projects to understand the business processes and lead testing
 
Must haves:
·Minimum 3-5 years in leading software projects in Testing area
·Expertise in Software testing and best practices
·Strong project management skillset
·Strong leadership skills
·Strong communication – written and verbal
·Reporting and metrics
 
Nice to have:
·ADO experience
·SAP experience is a plus
 
Technical Components of the position includes such tools and technologies as MS Azure DevOps, MS Visual Studio, Service Now, SAP, Web Technologies, Microsoft Office suite, etc.
 
Who you are:  
We are looking for someone who is self-directed and highly motivated to deliver results. You should be driven, energetic, flexible, and able to coordinate people and processes globally. You will enjoy working with us if you enjoy interacting with many different people, leading software projects, learning many different business processes and technologies, and exploring new tools and new ways of working.  You should have both strong software quality knowledge & leadership skills to join our team.
 
Qualifications: 
 
·Bachelor’s degree
·Minimum 3-5 years in leading software projects in Testing area
·Expertise in leading testing projects and has experience in Testing methodology, practices, processes and tools
·Expertise in coordinating testing for global programs/projects
·Strong leadership/interpersonal skills and project management skillset
·Ambitious team player, who is collaborative with all audiences
·Ability to quickly jump into projects to understand the business processes and lead testing
·Ability to embrace details and understand the ‘big picture’ and contribute to the successful delivery of milestones
·Experience working in Agile/SCRUM software development environment and strong knowledge of SCRUM practices
·Understanding of programming and development languages such as Java, C, .NET
·Experience in testing web, SAP application

job.title: Senior Element Management Systems Developer (34609)
job.description:
Myticas is looking for a Senior Element management System (EMS) developer who will be responsible for ensuring the smooth operation of our network by designing, implementing and maintaining EMS.
Main Responsibilities
•    Analyze requirements and design EMS FCAP applications to configure, monitor and manage network elements
•    Work closely with vendors to evaluate and implement new EMS solutions and stay up to date with industry trends.
•    Review and approve design and development solution documents, internal and external test strategies, plans, test cases and scripts.
•    Develop and maintain accurate and up to date documentation of EMS requirements, configurations, processes and procedures.
•    Design, Develop, test and maintain Yang modules to implement resource and service management
•    Implement real time network monitoring solutions to proactively identify and resolve network issues, minimizing downtime.
•    Investigate and resolve complex implementation and network problems, collaborating with cross-functional teams to implement effective solutions.
•    Develop and maintain automated test cases to verify element management functions.
•    Implement and enforce security best practices to protect network systems and data integrity.
Education and Experience Required
•    Bachelor's in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering, or a related field.
•    5-10 years of experience in a similar role.
•    Solid programming experience in python and C++17 in Linux environment
•    Solid knowledge of modelling languages such as YANG 1.1, UML is a must
•    Hands-on experience in developing application with gRPC, gNMI, gNOI, mTLS protocols
•    Working knowledge with docker, docker compose and containerized applications in embedded systems
•    Working experience in one of EMS/NMS tools and platforms such as Calian CMP, Netcracker Digital OSS, ONAP, Ciena Blue Planet
•    Knowledge in Carrier Ethernet technologies, standards, and protocols.
•    Familiarity with TMForum Open Digital Architecture (ODA), Process Framework (eTOM), TMForum APIs, is a plus
•    Familiarity with Model-based systems engineering (MBSE) is an asset.
•    Knowledge of MEF Lifecycle Service Orchestration (MEF LSO APIs) framework is an asset

job.title: Solution Architect – Enterprise SaaS (Delivery) - Canada (34568)
job.description:
Role & Responsibilities
  • Guide financial institutions through the adoption of enterprise SaaS solutions by applying deep understanding of end-to-end architectures—from legacy platforms to modern cloud SaaS environments.
  • Articulate the business value of the Client’s platform within each bank’s broader architectural ecosystem.
  • Collaborate closely across internal product, engineering, sales, and delivery teams, as well as with customers and industry partners, to ensure proposed solutions are technically sound, strategically aligned, and aligned to client business objectives and modernization roadmaps.
  • Engage in solving complex business challenges through technology, with an ability to translate architecture decisions into business outcomes.
Objectives
  • Enhance Customer Value Through Strategic Engagement – Partner with clients to understand priorities, co-create architectural roadmaps, and position the Client’s platform within their end-to-end ecosystems.
  • Drive Enterprise SaaS Architecture Excellence – Provide complete architectural guidance from legacy transformation through SaaS adoption, ensuring designs are robust, scalable, and aligned to business and technical goals.
  • Foster High-Performing Cross-Functional Collaboration – Mentor team members, champion best practices, and support alignment across engineering, product, and delivery functions.
Components of the Role
  • Collaborate internally with SMEs, business stakeholders, and technical leadership.
  • Operate as an external client-facing architect to ensure successful delivery outcomes.
Required Technical Skills
  • Extensive enterprise SaaS experience with strong client-facing solution delivery background.
  • Strong technical foundation in banking architectures, including core banking, modernization, pricing, and billing across retail, corporate, and commercial banking.
  • Ability to design scalable, secure, and reliable systems leveraging microservices, APIs, and integration frameworks.
  • Experience with CI/CD, containerization (Docker, Kubernetes), DevOps pipelines, and automation tooling.
  • Knowledge of identity management, encryption, and regulatory standards (SOC 2, GDPR, ISO 27001).
  • Ability to produce clear and comprehensive architecture documentation for development and delivery teams.
Important:

We’re targeting a Senior-to-Director-level professional—someone capable of shaping strategy and driving results across multiple teams and geographies. The ideal candidate brings strong autonomy, strategic judgement, and exceptional executive-level communication and influence skills. A minimum of  8+ years of banking/banking domain and architecture experience and 12+ years of overall industry experience is required.
 
Delivery Responsibilities (Solution Architect – Delivery Focus)
  • Act as the primary Solution Architect during delivery engagements, working hands-on with client teams to ensure implementation aligns with the defined target architecture.
  • Provide architectural oversight throughout delivery, including design reviews, integration decisions, data flow modeling, and resolution of technical blockers.
  • Ensure continuity between pre-sales solutioning and delivery execution, maintaining architectural integrity and solution intent.
  • Partner with project managers and engineering leads to validate requirements, guide technical workstreams, and ensure delivered outcomes meet the proposed architecture.
Additional Skills
  • Strategic Problem Solving: Ability to design innovative, technology-driven solutions aligned to business strategy.
  • Communication & Stakeholder Management: Strong ability to translate complex technical concepts into clear business language.
  • Collaboration & Leadership: Works effectively across cross-functional teams and stakeholder groups.
  • Decision-Making Under Uncertainty: Makes sound architectural decisions with limited information while balancing risk, cost, and performance.

job.title: Network Management System Developer (34608)
job.description:
Myticas is looking for a Senior NMS developer, who will be responsible for ensuring the seamless operation of our clients network by leading the design, implementation, and maintenance of the NMS of the system.
Main Responsibilities
  • Lead the design and analysis of NMS applications for managing network elements.
  • Drive vendor collaboration to evaluate and integrate NMS solutions aligned with industry standards and emerging technologies.
  • Oversee technical documentation to ensure architectural integrity and development quality.
  • Maintain comprehensive NMS documentation to support transparency, maintainability, and operational efficiency.
  • Develop YANG modules for modular resource, service, fault and performance management.
  • Lead resolution of complex implementation and network issues through cross-functional coordination and root cause analysis.
  • Design and maintain advanced automated test suites to support NMS validation and CI/CD practices.
  • Define security standards to ensure system integrity and policy compliance.
  • Contribute to system-level modeling, including interface definitions and CONOPS for Lightspeed.
  • Collaborate across engineering and operations teams to ensure seamless NMS integration.
  • Recommend and drive system-wide improvements to the architecture.
Education and Experience Required
  • Bachelor's in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering, or a related field.
  • 12+ years of experience in a similar role.
  • Demonstrated knowledge of design principles, and specifications for standardized and interoperable NMS Systems.
  • Solid knowledge of EMS protocols and modelling languages such as: NETCONF/RESTCONF, gRPC/gNMI, gNOI, YANG, UML
  • Familiarity with TMForum Open Digital Architecture (ODA), Process Framework (eTOM), TMForum APIs, is a plus
  • Familiarity with Model-based systems engineering (MBSE) is an asset.
  • Knowledge of MEF Lifecycle Service Orchestration (MEF LSO APIs) framework is an asset

job.title: Packet Core Support Engineer (34584)
job.description:
Myticas is looking for a Packet Core Support Engineer.  This person will support our clients customers.

Candidates Must have and be able to discuss in detail during a technical interview.
• Hands-on experience in managing, operating and supporting core network nodes (EPC/IMS/5GC) for both data and voice services.
• Solid experience in interfaces and protocols used in 4G and 5G core networks (integration/troubleshooting).
• Solid experience in Kubernetes and container environments for operating and managing Containerized Network Functions.

Candidate must have recent expereince with the ability to complete the following requirements:
Core RE Requirements:
• Perform first level of troubleshooting/response for anomalies found in the above elements.
• Raise tickets with care for issues that he couldn’t solve.
• Support activities/migrations/upgrades on behalf of customer (those are normally carried out by care team).
• Prepare/review MOPs of activities.
• Participate in ORT/ATP.
• Provide incident reports and kpi reports (if this is covered in the sow for RE).

REQUIREMENTS (must have):
• Experience in 4G and 5G packet core operation and architecture.
• Experience in SDM operation and architecture.
• Knowledge of CNF operation and lifecycle management.
• O&M experience in mme, spgw, amf, smf, upf, nrf.
• O&M experience in pcrf, hss, pcf, udm, ausf, udr.
• O&M experience in cscf, TAS, sbc, mrf.

job.title: Storage Architect (34636)

Provide ongoing support for various environments, at a minimum, in the form of:

  • Testing
  • User Acceptance Testing

job.title: SAP Ariba Functional Consultant (34654)
job.description:

This role requires strong functional leadership, workstream ownership, and hands-on experience across all phases of delivery.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Lead the functional workstream for SAP Ariba implementation and enhancements.

  • Facilitate business process design workshops and document process flows.

  • Develop functional specifications and configuration workbooks.

  • Support system build activities, including configuration validation and defect management.

  • Plan and coordinate User Acceptance Testing (UAT), including bilingual (EN/FR) sessions.

  • Ability to lead workshops, guide business stakeholders, and manage functional delivery.

  • Experience supporting technical teams throughout system build and integration phases.

  • Excellent communication and stakeholder management skills.

job.title: Lab Tech - Micro (34637)
job.description:
Clover Consulting has a direct client in Grand Rapids, MI in need of an entry-level Lab Tech for Microbiology Laboratory Testing.  This is for an on-site, 6-month contract with the potential for extensions or perm hire. 

Job Title: Lab Tech-Micro Laboratory Testing
Contract: W2– Candidates must be authorized to work in the U.S. on a W2 basis. We cannot accept candidates requiring sponsorship or those from C2C vendors.
Duration: 6 months with possible multi-year extension/s or hire
Location: Grand Rapids, MI; Considering local candidates only.


Micro Lab Technician: Laboratory Testing
This is an entry level position for a Microbiology Lab Technician, which operates under the Quality Control Unit. In this role you will be supporting testing and release of raw materials, finished consumer goods, and/or environmental samples.

This first shift position will work as part of a cohesive laboratory team which often uses a rotational schedule to keep the work interesting and to ensure workload is covered. You will be trained on multiple techniques within the micro laboratory and will be kept up-to-date with team meetings. Daily duties may include cleaning, record keeping, media preparation, and calibration of equipment. Once trained, occasional weekend work may be required.

Skills to be successful in the role:
• Flexible team player
• Attention to detail
• Ability to communicate and elevate issues to leadership
• Ability to sit, stand, and lift up to 50lbs
• GMP microbiology laboratory experience preferred

Required qualifications:
• Laboratory experience (in education or industry)
• Demonstrated ability to follow SOPs/test methods

Education: 2 years of college in a science related field and/or demonstrated experience in microbiology laboratory procedures

job.title: Cloud Operations Director (Architecture/Hands-On) (34660)
job.description:
• Proven 10+ years in cloud/platform operations, with 5+ years leading Azure operations teams in complex, high-availability environments.

  • Hands-on technical leader: primarily an operational/people leader (?80%), but still capable of engaging at keyboard level during escalations and guiding engineers through critical issues.

  • Deep operational ownership across Azure services (AKS, App Service, Functions, networking, Private Link, vWAN/hub-spoke, Front Door, Key Vault, Entra ID, SQL/Cosmos, Storage, Event Hubs, Service Bus).

  • Demonstrated leadership of large global teams (?25 engineers) with coverage across Canada + India time zones and responsibility for tight internal/external SLA adherence.

  • Strong in incident, problem, and change management, with a track record of improving MTTA/MTTR, reducing change failure rate, and driving operational excellence.

  • High proficiency in IaC (Terraform/Bicep) and automation-first practices; proven history of reducing toil via pipelines, runbooks, and standardized provisioning patterns.

  • Experience running critical production systems in cloud with accountability for provisioning, lifecycle management, DR/BCP, observability, compliance, and cost governance.

  • Strong command of security & compliance operations, including RBAC/PIM, Key Vault hygiene, vulnerability remediation, audit evidence management (SOC2/ISO27001/PCI exposure preferred).

  • Strategic operator who can define and execute a vision/roadmap for Cloud Operations, driving process maturity, governance, operational discipline, and continuous improvement.

  • Exceptional communicator capable of interfacing with executives, customers, vendors, MSPs, and internal engineering teams, with disciplined documentation and leadership presence.

job.title: Senior SAP TM Functional Consultant (34618)

job.title: Azure Developer – ENTRA External / IAM Migration (34640)
job.description:
Our client in the insurance sector is seeking an Azure Developer with strong IAM migration experience, specifically migrating identity platforms from Salesforce IAM to Azure ENTRA External.

This is a senior, hands-on role requiring deep expertise in IAM technologies, cloud security, and migration strategy execution. The developer will collaborate with business, security, and IT stakeholders while designing and delivering a secure, scalable identity platform.

Key Responsibilities

  • Lead the migration of the IAM platform from Salesforce IAM ? Azure ENTRA External

  • Design and execute secure, scalable IAM architecture

  • Integrate Azure ENTRA External with applications, systems, and third-party services

  • Implement best practices for identity governance, MFA, conditional access, and access control

  • Collaborate with business/security/IT teams on requirements and progress updates

  • Troubleshoot complex IAM issues throughout the migration

  • Maintain technical documentation (architecture, configurations, processes)

Required Skills & Experience

  • Strong experience with Azure ENTRA External, Azure Functions, Azure Storage, Conditional Access, Identity Governance

  • Hands-on experience with Salesforce IAM and its integration points

  • Deep understanding of OAuth 2.0, SAML, SCIM, OpenID Connect (OIDC)

  • Proven IAM migration experience — ideally Salesforce ? Azure

  • Familiarity with Zero Trust, RBAC, and cloud security best practices

  • Strong communication and ability to manage project timelines

job.title: Business Development Manager – IT Staffing Services (32553)
job.description:
Title: Business Development Manager – IT Staffing Services.

About us: Myticas Consulting Group of Companies. Myticas specializes in IT Staffing and Recruitment Services with over 50 years of combined experience in the IT Staffing industry. We serve clients in all industries in the United States and Canada with offices in Ottawa, Chicago, Atlanta, Cleveland, and Grand Rapids. 

About the position: The Sr. Business Development professional will sit in our Chicago, Illinois office This position is a hybrid role and requires some travel. This position is responsible for Business Development in this area as a priority, but able to develop business in OH, PA, WV, IN, IL, etc. This position comes with a competitive salary, commission, bonus potential, medical, dental, vision, 401K, and PTO. This professional would have full access to training, access to and support from the marketing department and technical tools in support of their success. 

Job Duties and Responsibilities:

  • Initiate contact, develop relationships, and conduct business development activities with clients and professionals; networking and connecting with IT professionals, executives, managers, and other professionals and resources at potential, new, and existing clients.
  • Research and qualify new clients, conducting business development activities and negotiating terms of service and agreements with new clients.
  • Provided expert level staffing support to clients, hiring managers, and professionals. Qualifying technical position requirements and coordinating with technical recruiters to fulfill staffing needs for new and existing clients.
  • Represent and market the  Myticas Consulting Group brands.
  • Participate, network at, support, and sponsor events involving the technical community.
  • Sell via telephone, face-to-face and videoconferencing.
  • Utilize Bullhorn CRM/Application tracking system for client and manager outreach and keep CRM documentation, agreements, resources, and paperwork up to date.

Required Experience:

  • 5 to 10+ years’ demonstrated record of success selling staffing services, preferably with experience in the IT environment.
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
  • Outstanding customer service, integrity, and interpersonal skills.  
  • Energetic, enthusiastic, self-motivated, collaborative.
  • Passion for the staffing industry, excellent work ethic, and strong desire to succeed.

job.title: General Construction Superintendent (34633)
job.description:
General Superintendent, Construction 

On Site; McCarran, NV
Salary: $120,000.00 - $170,000.00

A leading engineering, procurement, and construction (EPC) organization is seeking a General Site Superintendent to oversee large-scale industrial projects from installation through start-up. This role is central to coordinating construction activities across multiple disciplines and ensuring project execution aligns with design intent, safety standards, budget expectations, and schedule requirements. The General Site Superintendent will supervise all site-level scopes, lead the team of discipline Superintendents, and act as a key liaison between construction, engineering, project management, project controls, and procurement teams.

Key Responsibilities

  • Oversee all field construction activities and act as the primary link between engineering, estimating, and site crews to ensure adherence to drawings, specifications, and contractual requirements.

  • Directly supervise all superintendents and manage all field scopes assigned to the project.

  • Coordinate field operations to maintain safe, efficient alignment with the project schedule.

  • Manage site logistics including deliveries, access, sequencing of work areas, and coordination with adjacent project teams.

  • Plan work methods, materials, equipment, and manpower needs; review daily schedules with direct reports and update weekly schedules based on field progress.

  • Review and interpret project specifications; coordinate with work crews, field engineers, design engineering, utilities, and local authorities to safely support field work.

  • Forecast schedule needs, identify potential issues, and recommend technical or scheduling solutions.

  • Provide technical input to resolve risks related to methods, materials, safety, and schedule; document daily site activities and meeting notes using approved systems.

  • Support leadership with additional assignments as needed.

  • Present production work plans during project kickoff to ensure alignment across teams.

  • Coordinate with internal equipment groups and external vendors to ensure adequate equipment and material availability for safe and timely execution.

  • Oversee construction of complex mechanical and piping scopes within industrial, process, or treatment plant environments.

  • Coordinate inspections and ensure all required testing and approvals are completed on schedule.

  • Enforce strict safety standards, identify training needs, and support the project’s safety culture.

  • Supervise subcontractor performance, recommend workflow adjustments, and ensure compliance with project requirements.

  • Lead project closeout activities, ensuring documentation and turnover meet organizational and authority requirements.

  • Maintain alignment with company values, project goals, and overall strategy.

Desired Qualifications

  • 15+ years of construction experience, with preference for industrial, process plant, or manufacturing environments.

  • 10+ years of leadership experience managing construction teams or superintendents.

  • Bachelor’s degree preferred.

  • Safety Trained Supervisor (STS) certification preferred.

  • OSHA 30-hour certification preferred.

  • Valid driver’s license required.

  • Strong verbal and written communication skills.

  • Experience with 3D model reviews, Navisworks, or clash detection tools preferred.

  • Advanced knowledge of construction equipment, operations, and maintenance requirements.

  • Strong understanding of construction safety protocols and ability to enforce them.

  • Familiarity with union or prevailing wage requirements, if applicable.

  • Ability to read and interpret technical standards, plans, and specifications.

  • Strong analytical and mathematical skills; able to evaluate data and draw sound conclusions.

  • Passion for continuous improvement, innovation, and high-performance project delivery.

job.title: Business Architect / Consultant – Digital Commerce & Manufacturing (34643)
job.description:
We are seeking a highly experienced Business Architect/Consultant with a strong understanding of the Industrial Manufacturing sector. This role plays a key part in helping our clients recognize the value of their partnership with us—acting as a strategic advisor across B2B, B2C/DTC Commerce, PIM, Supply Chain, and Marketplace initiatives.

Role Overview
The Business Architect/Consultant works at the intersection of business strategy and digital commerce execution. You will guide clients through discovery, define future-state solutions, support implementation teams, and serve as a trusted thought partner who brings clarity, structure, and industry insight to complex challenges.

Key Responsibilities
Discovery & Engagement Leadership
  • Support the leadership of client engagements by driving discovery activities and shaping the strategic direction.
  • Conduct structured workshops (requirements gathering, current-state analysis, pain-point exploration, and future-state visioning) to extract detailed, actionable insights.
  • Convert business challenges into clearly articulated requirements, user stories, and process designs—surfacing gaps, dependencies, and risks across business and technology teams.
  • Produce high-quality discovery deliverables, including:
  • As-is and to-be process flows
  • Requirements documentation
  • User journeys, use cases, and activity diagrams
  • Integration and data considerations
  • Executive-ready summaries and recommendations
Strategic Advisory
  • Operate as a trusted advisor to senior client leaders by applying deep knowledge of Manufacturing and Digital Commerce ecosystems.
  • Provide guidance on strategic roadmaps, operating models, and modernization approaches.
  • Advise on digital commerce platform capabilities, solution components, and architectural considerations in partnership with technical architects.
  • Prepare concise decision-ready materials that help executives prioritize investments and understand business impact.
  • Assess digital commerce strategies or channels and recommend initiatives to drive measurable growth or efficiency.
Client Delivery & Implementation Support
  • Work closely with Engagement Managers/Directors to maintain scope, manage stakeholders, and ensure successful execution.
  • Ensure requirements are ready for implementation teams; validate estimates, assumptions, and solution approaches.
  • Collaborate with development and architecture teams to evaluate trade-offs between usability, performance, and technical feasibility.
  • Participate in or lead quarterly business reviews with clients to guide ongoing success and optimization.
Thought Leadership
  • Engage with industry analysts and stay current with trends in commerce, supply chain, and industrial manufacturing.
  • Create thought leadership content (articles, whitepapers, short videos/webinars) showcasing expertise in Manufacturing and Digital Commerce.
  • Represent The Company at conferences, webinars, and industry events as a subject-matter expert.

Qualifications
  • Bachelor’s degree in Business, Computer Science, Marketing, Engineering, or a related field.
  • 5+ years of experience as a Business Analyst, Business Architect, Solution Architect, or similar role within eCommerce or digital transformation environments.
  • Strong familiarity with the Industrial Manufacturing domain is highly preferred.
  • Proven background in eCommerce consulting—including strategy development, financial/business modeling, and competitive analysis.
  • Demonstrated ability to lead complex initiatives and deliver solutions within scope, timelines, and budgets.
  • Excellent communication skills, including the ability to present to C-Suite audiences and distill complex information into clear priorities.

Preferred Skills
  • Business Analysis certification (e.g., CBAP, CCBA).
  • Experience working in a consulting or professional services environment.

job.title: Construction Manager (34641)
job.description:
Construction Manager
Louisville CO

Salary: $92,000 - $157,00
Bonus opportunity
Benefits: Standard Medical, Dental, 401(k)




The Construction Manager will plan, direct, and lead activities of a designated construction project to ensure that the goals and objectives of projects are accomplished within the prescribed budget and time frame. Will support the installation and commissioning of integrated, modular, and packaged systems in renewable energy, traditional energy, and mining.
 
This leader must have the desire to perform quality work safely, be detail-oriented, have superior customer focus. and be able to work independently as well as in a team environment. 

RESPONSIBILITIES
 
  • Manage and plan installation and integration of mechanical, electrical, and controls systems.
  • Establish goals and deadlines for all project activities daily.
  • Establish a work plan within specific project parameters by utilizing resources and staff.
  • Effectively communicate with project staff and outline a work plan by assigning duties and responsibilities.
  • Manage the budget and required change orders for the construction project.
  • Assist the Project Manager with cost forecasts and financial projections of the construction scope.
  • Manage the punch list action items and closeout process
  • Monitor and adjust project plans based on changes in the project.
  • Travel domestically and internationally 50-60% of the time. Daily local travel required 30-50% of the time.
  • Responsible for site cost, schedule, safety, productivity, and full understanding of the scope of work.
  • Lead daily on and off-site meetings by providing subcontractors with a detailed list of items that are complete and incomplete.
  • Oversee contractor installation methods to ensure quality and safety are maintained.
  • Effectively serves as a point of contact with the customer and ensures that communication is handled in a professional and timely manner.
  • Lead and participate in regular internal and external progress meetings communicating progress to plan, issues, and areas for improvement.
  • Review subcontractor bid documents and change requests against the contracted scope of work.
  • Keep proper documentation dialogs about all issues regarding the project including, but not limited to: Contractor change order summaries, bid results, subcontractor agreements, daily field reports, schedules, change requests, field directives, punch list documentation, and installation check-out documents.
  • Promote a positive working environment to achieve the organization’s goals.

REQUIREMENTS
 
  • 5+ years in a construction setting, large steel and pipe assembly or refinery
  • Experience in the heavy industrial, oil & gas, utility, renewable energy, mining or similar industry
  • Project management experience
  • Experience managing sub-contractors
  • A focus on safety is required with Project Safety Management Covered Process experience is preferred.
  • Experience managing quality and root cause analysis
  • Ability to interpret mechanical, civil, and structural engineer/designer notes, plans, and sketches for incorporation into design documents is required
  • Ability to interpret electrical and control engineer/designer notes, plans, and sketches is preferred.
  • A driver’s license in good standing is required
  • OSHA 10 or 30hr certificate is preferred
  • Proactive mindset with excellent organization, planning, and communication skills is required.
  • Basic drafting skills and methods is preferred
  • Computer skills and in-depth knowledge of Microsoft Windows-based programs are required.
  • Technical Associates Degree or Bachelor's Degree in Construction Management or a related field is preferred, but not required.
  • Must be able to travel up to three hours from Louisville, CO up to 50-60% of the time.

We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, genetic information, sexual orientation, gender identity, or any other legally protected status. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to any of these characteristics.

job.title: Data Governance Specialist (34661)
job.description:
Our health-sector client is seeking a Data Governance Specialist to support enterprise-wide initiatives across metadata management, data quality, data ownership, and stewardship. This remote/ HYBRID role will work closely with business teams, governance leads, and external partners to strengthen governance capabilities and operationalize data governance practices across the organization.
Deliverables
  • Updated metadata glossary and aligned definitions.
  • Validated CDEs and documented data quality rules.
  • Refined data ownership and stewardship framework, including roles and responsibilities.
  • Business-approved documentation for metadata and data quality updates.

  • Training and awareness support.

Required Skills & Qualifications
  • Strong expertise in data governance frameworks, metadata management, and data quality practices.

  • Familiarity with Microsoft Purview or similar enterprise data cataloging tools.
  • Experience operationalizing data governance within business units.
  • Demonstrated ability to facilitate business alignment on governance standards and definitions.
  • Knowledge of data stewardship and ownership models.
  • Excellent communication and stakeholder engagement skills.

job.title: MS Dynamics 365 Finance & Operations (D365 F&O) (34662)
job.description:
Our consulting partner is seeking a Senior Tech Developer for MS Dynamics 365 Finance & Operations for a remote contract in the Toronto to support development, integration, and data management activities throughout the engagement.

Key Responsibilities

  • Customization & Development: Build and enhance reports, extensions, workflows, and D365 customizations; perform development and bug fixes using X++.

  • Data Management: Execute data migrations; create reporting solutions using SSRS and Power BI; support Dataverse integration.

  • Integration & APIs: Implement integrations using REST/SOAP APIs, Azure Logic Apps, and Power Automate.

  • Technical Documentation: Prepare and maintain technical documentation, ensuring alignment with development best practices.

Required Skills & Qualifications

  • Strong hands-on D365 F&O technical development experience, including X++.

  • Experience with data migration, SSRS, Power BI, and Dataverse.

  • Proven experience implementing REST/SOAP APIs and Azure-based integration solutions.

job.title: Microsoft AI Automation Specialist (34667)
job.description:
Our financial-sector client is seeking a Microsoft AI Automation Specialist to support AI, data, and automation initiatives under the direction of the Assistant Director of Data Digital Services. This role provides expert guidance across Microsoft Fabric, Power Platform, AI Foundry, and Copilot, while designing AI-driven architectural patterns and delivering modern automation solutions. The consultant will work hands-on with Python, Azure services, and large language models (LLMs) to build and integrate AI capabilities across enterprise platforms such as SharePoint, Databricks, ServiceNow, and SAP.

Key Responsibilities

  • Provide expert knowledge of Microsoft Fabric, Power Platform, AI Foundry, and Copilot platforms.

  • Develop architectural plans and patterns to support and advance the Bank’s AI strategy.

  • Support Azure and AI deliverables, collaborating with internal SMEs and technical teams.

  • Develop solutions using Python and implement integrations with LLMs.

  • Design and implement integrations across systems including SharePoint, Databricks, ServiceNow, and SAP.

  • Create user guides, documentation, and technical materials.

  • Perform other related activities and deliverables as required.

Required Qualifications & Skills

  • University degree or college diploma in Computer Science, or equivalent experience with a strong AI focus.

  • 5+ years of recent work experience with Azure technologies.

  • 5+ years of recent experience developing with Python.

  • 1+ year of recent experience working with LLMs and platforms such as SharePoint, Databricks, ServiceNow, SAP, Power Platform, and Microsoft Fabric.

  • Demonstrated experience designing, building, training, evaluating, integrating, and testing AI deliverables.

  • Strong understanding of model deployment and integration patterns.

  • Demonstrated experience creating user guides and documentation.

  • Proven experience working as an AI Engineer.

Additional Qualifications (Nice to Have)

  • Experience with PostgreSQL.

job.title: D365 Technical Developer (34663)
job.description:

The consultant will support a major transformation initiative, delivering custom development, integrations, and data management activities across the program. This role involves enhancing existing functionality, building new extensions, resolving technical issues, and ensuring solutions follow D365 best practices.   • Hands-on experience with data migration, data cleansing, SSRS, Power BI, and Dataverse integration.

  • Analyze, design, and implement enhancements to meet business requirements.

  • Maintain collaborative relationships with internal clients and external partners.

Required Qualifications & Skills

Additional Qualifications (Nice to Have)

job.title: Senior Embedded Developer - Principal (34672)
job.description:
Principal Embedded Software Developer will play a pivotal role in driving the architectural and design aspects of our software projects.
They will collaborate closely with System Engineering and other cross-functional teams to ensure seamless integration and alignment with our organizational objectives and be a technical lead within the Scrum Team, guiding and influencing the team's decisions to achieve optimal outcomes. In addition, they will lead technical discussions with our valued vendors and partners, fostering strong relationships and provide vital day-to-day guidance to team members, promoting a cohesive and productive work environment.
MAIN RESPONSIBILITIES:
    • Lead the design, development, and implementation of advanced satellite ground segment software systems, ensuring high performance, scalability, and reliability.
    • Lead the design, development, and implementation of embedded application software, board support software and OS integration
    • Collaborate closely with cross-functional teams to define architecture, technical specifications, and software requirements for ground segment systems.
    • Provide technical leadership, mentorship, and guidance to the engineering team, fostering a collaborative and innovative environment.
    • Architect software solutions that adhere to Test-Driven Development (TDD) principles and utilize simulated software to rigorously test code functionality.
    • Design software with a profound understanding of hardware resource limitations to ensure optimal performance in resource-constrained environments.
    • Stay current with the latest advancements in satellite technology and industry trends, driving innovation and maintaining technical excellence.
    • Implement and support MPLS/WAN/SD-WAN circuits and subnets.
    • Guide the team in troubleshooting and resolving complex technical issues, ensuring the stability and reliability of ground segment software.
    • Collaborate with stakeholders to gather requirements and translate them into effective technical solutions.
    • Utilize expertise in cloud technology, virtualization, and containerization to optimize software deployment and management.
    • Leverage software modeling tools to create robust and efficient software architectures.
    • Foster a culture of continuous improvement, helping to evolve development processes, tools, and methodologies.
EDUCATION & EXPERIENCE REQUIRED
    • Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, or a related field.
    • 10 + years of experience in software development, focusing on satellite communication systems.
Specialized Knowledge, Skills and Abilities
    • Knowledge of systems engineering fundamentals (networking, storage, operating systems)
    • Experience programming with at least one or more programming languages such as C++, Java, Python, Golang, PowerShell
    • Deep understanding of satellite technology, ground segment operations, and associated challenges.
    • Good understanding of networking and routing protocols 
    • Experience supporting and implementing MPLS/WAN/SD-WAN circuits and subnets.
    • Prior experience in a technical leadership or architecture role.
    • Strong problem-solving skills, capable of addressing intricate technical challenges.
    • Excellent communication skills to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams and stakeholders.
    • Familiarity with Test-Driven Development (TDD) and simulated software testing methodologies.
    • Ability to design software with consideration for hardware resource constraints.
    • Experience with cloud technology, virtualization, and containerization.
    • Proficiency in using software modeling tools to create robust architectures.
    • Familiarity with Agile development methodologies.
    • Experience working with geographically dispersed teams.

job.title: UX Designer (34671)
job.description:
• Leads discovery activities to understand users, define audience segments, and map end-to-end customer journeys that inform product strategy.

  • Conducts qualitative and quantitative research (interviews, usability sessions, behavioral studies) to surface user needs, pain points, and opportunity areas.

  • Translates research findings into actionable artifacts such as personas, journey maps, workflow diagrams, and experience recommendations.

  • Evaluates existing digital products—especially B2B applications—to identify UX gaps, workflow friction, and optimization opportunities.

  • Applies Human-Computer Interaction (HCI) principles to ensure intuitive interaction patterns and user-centred design decisions.

  • Leverages analytics and research tools (e.g., GA4, Hotjar, insight platforms) to validate assumptions, detect behavioral patterns, and support data-driven decisions.

  • Uses collaborative design tools (Figma, Miro, etc.) to prototype concepts, facilitate workshops, and guide cross-functional teams through ideation and solutioning.

  • Communicates research insights, concepts, and design rationale clearly to stakeholders to ensure shared alignment across discovery and delivery phases.

  • Partners with marketing/brand teams to incorporate visual identity and brand expression into user experiences.

  • Synthesizes complex data into clear experience frameworks, demonstrating creativity, strong organization, and attention to detail while staying current with UX industry practices.

job.title: Embedded Software Developer (34673)
job.description:
In this role, Senior Embedded Software Developer will assume ownership of specific software modules, overseeing their development, quality, and functionality. 
As an integral part of our scrum team, this role will contribute to the design, development/coding and testing of our cutting edge Software by actively engaging with both the test and support teams to ensure comprehensive testing and efficient bug resolution. In addition, you will take the lead in technical discussions and guide decision-making processes and lead and document technical discussions.

MAIN RESPONSIBILITIES:
    • Collaborate with experienced engineers in the design, coding, testing, and maintenance of software applications.
    • Develop and maintain embedded software modules using programming languages like C++ and Python.
    • Assist in the implementation of networking solutions, ensuring seamless communication between software components.
    • Contribute to the development of software tools, libraries, and frameworks to enhance overall product quality and efficiency.
    • Participate in code reviews, providing constructive feedback to enhance code quality and adherence to coding standards.
    • Collaborate with the team to troubleshoot and resolve software defects and technical issues.
    • Support the integration of software components on Linux operating systems.
    • Assist in the testing and validation of software features, ensuring functionality and performance meet specified requirements.
    • Utilize cloud technologies to enhance software deployment and management.
    • Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including product managers and designers, to understand requirements and contribute to technical discussions.
    • Maintain clear and organized documentation of software designs, processes, and development tasks.
    • Demonstrate effective teamwork and communication skills, both orally and in writing. Lead the design, development, and implementation of advanced satellite ground segment software systems, ensuring high performance, scalability, and reliability.

EDUCATION & EXPERIENCE REQUIRED:
    • Bachelor's in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering, or a related field.
    • 8+ year software development experience in embedded system (Linux, ARM cores) with experience in software and firmware upgrades and device commissioning (YANG).
    • 8+ year experience in developing and troubleshooting low level application services which interface to devices through hardware interface.
    • 8+ year experience in developing software using modern C/ C++.
    • Good understanding of L1/L2 networking protocols (IPSEC, MACsec, secure tunnel), NETCONF.
    • Experience with platform module for platform security.
    • SW development in the satellite communication systems is a plus.
    • Working experience with Agile scrum methodology.

job.title: ASIC Design Engineer (34680)
job.description:
We are seeking a highly experienced Senior ASIC Design Engineer to join a high-performance hardware development team. This role involves end-to-end ASIC design, from micro-architecture definition through implementation and debug, supporting advanced high-speed communication systems.

Key Responsibilities

  • Define micro-architecture and contribute to system-level ASIC design decisions

  • Implement and verify complex digital logic for high-performance ASICs

  • Debug functional, timing, and integration issues across the design lifecycle

  • Collaborate closely with architecture, verification, physical design, and system teams

  • Support design reviews, documentation, and design sign-off activities

  • Contribute to continuous improvement of design methodologies and tools

Required Skills and Experience

  • Bachelor’s degree in Electrical or Computer Engineering; advanced degree preferred

  • Minimum of 10 years of hands-on ASIC design experience

  • Strong skills in micro-architecture, RTL design, and design debugging

  • Excellent problem-solving and analytical abilities

  • Strong verbal and written communication skills

  • Solid understanding of the full ASIC design flow and associated EDA tools

  • Ability to work effectively in a collaborative, multi-disciplinary environment

Preferred Qualifications / Assets

  • Experience with MATLAB and scripting languages (e.g., Python, Perl, Tcl)

  • Familiarity with telecom and high-speed interface protocols such as OTN, CAUI, or similar

  • Working knowledge of DSP, FEC, and digital communication theory

  • Design experience supporting Ethernet standards from 100G through 800G

job.title: Project Administrator – Technology & Operations Integration (34683)
job.description:

This workstream manages high-volume, variable tasks requiring strong organization, responsiveness, and the ability to adapt to shifting priorities and timelines.

The Project Administrator will support onboarding/offboarding, event coordination, resourcing, invoicing, and general program administration under the supervision of the Delivery Lead.

Program Administration

Resourcing & Invoicing

Work Model

job.title: Guidewire Technical Lead (34690)

job.title: QA Sampler (34685)
job.description:
Job Title: QA Sampler
Contract: W2– Candidates must be authorized to work in the U.S. on a W2 basis. We cannot accept candidates requiring sponsorship or those from C2C vendors.
Duration: 6 months with possible multi-year extension/s
Pay: $19 per hour on W2 
Location: Grand Rapids, MI; Considering local candidates only

Clover Consulting has a direct client in Grand Rapids, MI in need of  a QA Sampler for a 6 months contract with the potential to go 3 years or perm. This is an ON-SITE role.  

Description:
The sampling position would include sampling all raw material and packaging components in several warehouses. The raw material sampling would include materials that are used in the cosmetic and home care products as well as materials that are used in the food industry including allergens. The packaging components would be sampled in the warehouse and this would include inspecting the shipment for defective components.

The materials that are sampled are logged in the QA data system where sampling data is entered. The samples are then delivered to the respective labs including micro, chemistry and packaging. This is NOT a QA laboratory job but may lead to opportunities to gain laboratory experience.

Requirements:
- A valid State of Michigan driver’s license. Candidate will be driving around complex.
- Basic computer skills.
- Science background or science degree is preferred but not required.
- Raw material samplers must wear shoes with full leather uppers.

job.title: Senior High-Speed Analog IC Design R&D Engineer (34222)
job.description:
You will be responsible for the development of integrated circuits operating at speeds greater than 100Gbaud for next-generation products. This role involves driving multiple aspects of IC product development, including circuit design, physical layout, and silicon bring-up. You will collaborate closely with teams across verification, CAD, product engineering, and test engineering to create and execute detailed design validation test (DVT) plans and device characterization strategies.

KEY SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE

Minimum Experience Requirements:

  • Proven experience in high-speed analog IC design using SiGe BiCMOS or CMOS technologies

  • Strong understanding of transmission lines and other high-frequency passive components

  • Solid grasp of device physics and its influence on analog circuit performance, along with techniques to optimize performance

  • Hands-on experience with RF wafer probing, lab instrumentation, and evaluation of high-speed analog ICs

  • Familiarity with Verilog-A and scripting languages such as Skill, Python, or shell scripts is an asset

  • Excellent teamwork, verbal, and written communication skills

Education Requirements:

  • BS with 5+ years of relevant experience

  • MS with 3+ years of relevant experience

  • PhD with related academic or professional experience


    Salary Range:  $130,000 - $260,000

job.title: Surveyor (34703)
job.description:
Survey Technician – Mid-Atlantic Region

Location: Mid-Atlantic Region (field-based, supporting regional projects)
Employment Type: Full-Time
Work Environment: Field and office-based (approximately 80% field / 20% office)
Travel: Required; projects primarily within metro areas and broader Mid-Atlantic region
Compensation: Competitive; based on experience

Position Overview

The Surveyor supports construction and geotechnical projects by performing accurate field layout, surveying, and as-built documentation. This role works closely with project managers, superintendents, and engineering teams to ensure survey data is accurate, timely, and aligned with project requirements. This role is travel heavy to sites 80% field & 20% office.

The position offers opportunities for professional growth and advancement.

Key Responsibilities

  • Compute coordinates for use in field layout

  • Perform field layout and as-built surveys

  • Prepare detailed and accurate as-built documentation and reports

  • Coordinate with project managers and field leadership to support project execution

  • Analyze survey data and assist in resolving discrepancies

  • Review and cross-check shop drawings and contract drawings, including structural, architectural, and civil plans

Qualifications

  • Associate’s degree minimum in a technical or related field

  • 2+ years of experience as a surveyor or in a similar role

  • Experience conducting fieldwork and preparing survey documentation

  • Proficiency with industry software such as AutoCAD, Revit, Bluebeam, and Microsoft Office

  • Ability to effectively operate survey equipment and related technology

  • Professional Land Surveying License preferred, but not required

  • Ability to travel extensively within the region as required

job.title: Civil 3D Designer (34696)
job.description:
Assistant Civil Designer
Location: Phoenix, AZ (On-site)
Contract to hire - 6 month conversion to direct employment
No sponsorship offered for this role
Benefits: Standard Medical, Dental and 401(k)
Pay Range: $28.00 - $35.00

Description:
An Assistant Civil Designer will assist in various phases of planning, proposal preparation, site evaluations, and preparation of construction drawings. This position will utilize AutoCAD Civil 3D to work on various projects with a diverse portfolio of project types and clients.   

Responsibilities:
  • Assist in designing various civil projects utilizing AutoCAD Civil 3D. Some example tasks would include site design, land development, roads, storm drainage systems, storm water management facilities, and sediment and erosion control.
  • Assist with a full range of drawing production work utilizing sheet manager, grading objects, X-Refs, and data references.
  • Preparation of engineering drawings from red lines, sketches, verbal feedback, and client feedback.
  • Assist with initial rough designs or sketches and mark-ups for ongoing projects.
  • Coordination of CAD files with other disciplines and clients internally and externally.
  • Compute volume calculations for excavation, grading, and roadway design.
  • Produce drawings and sketches using cross-sections and surveys to show elevations, contours, and proposed grade.
  • Organize and maintain all revisions of project drawings, plot files and project-related information in a logical and well-structured manner.
  • Perform quantity take-offs on models and design files to support estimate development.
  • Prepare functional model exports for distribution to subcontractors and construction personnel.
  • Incorporate schedules, budgets, and project criteria into civil design and layouts.
  • Familiar with AutoCAD Civil 3D labels.
  • Performs other duties as assigned.
Requirements:
  • Bachelor’s degree in drafting technology or related field and 2 years related experience Required – OR –  associate degree and 3 years related experience Required – OR – 4 years progressive detailing and design experience; Required.
  •  Basic understanding of design software such as: AutoCAD, Civil 3D, MicroStation, and Excel to develop the design deliverables. 
  • Basic knowledge in design, calculations and design systems. 
  • Basic knowledge in the theory and practices of civil discipline; competent in the fundamental concepts of other disciplines as they relate to the assigned discipline; and capable of operating related discipline design software necessary to execute production tasks. 
  • Ability to work collaboratively with others (Project Managers, Engineers and Designers) in a multi-discipline project team environment to resolve design or drawing issues as appropriate and to accomplish objectives. 
  • Excellent written & verbal communication skills. 
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, and attention to detail. 

We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, genetic information, sexual orientation, gender identity, or any other legally protected status. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to any of these characteristics.
